topic.title: [DEV] Any advice for setting a dev env of zite?
topic.body:
When dealing with the multi user zite, such as write file cmd, I don't know how to debug or test it.
Is there any effcient way other than running 5 vm for dummy users?

1_1L34ssdxfxnnSFEoUmy48LocCxnVAHtqSV.body:
> [nofish](#comment_893_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): I develop the sites on local machine, then before the release I test it by loading it to a ZeroNet client running on a VPS. If it works with 2 user, then it should work with more.

Thanks for helping.

The real problem is that if i have to frequently update the site under develpment. 

More detailed, I have:
- a script to generate html and processed js code.
- a zite owned by myself for testing

Everytime when I add up some new functions, I just run the script, update the js code in the testing zite, and test it in local browser via 43110/mytestingaddress.

This work flow works well for single user zite, but not for testing involving multi-user behavior, such as update users' data in `/data/usr/`.

If I visit it as an owener of that zite, I can do everything without the limitation of permission.
So, I setup serveral vagrant imgs running zeronet on the other ports of 127.0.0.1 such as 430120 or 430130.
But this works well only for the first time test. Since, after 1st testing, when I update the content of my zites, I have to sign and publish it in order to update it in other vm machines.
But publishing dosen't work for not update the updated zite to 5 nodes. ( I only run two vboxs)

Literally, I am stucked here for work flow of developing zites. 
In a nutshell, I don't know how to make other machines keep sync with my recent changes.

3_12JNkg22um5nYeLgK8XgKavpivuwjrfHAy.body: Owner can do everything. update del. etc.
